question: Which US President signed an executive order making English the official language of the U.S.?
What did President Trump's executive order on the official language of the U.S. rescind?
options: A policy requiring English to be the only language used by federal agencies.
A 2000 policy by Bill Clinton that required language assistance for non-English speakers.
A law establishing bilingual education in public schools.
The constitutional right to use languages other than English.
answer: A 2000 policy by Bill Clinton that required language assistance for non-English speakers.

options: It has been declared the national anthem of Bangladesh.
It has been adopted as the official motto of the central bank of Bangladesh.
It is being promoted as a cultural phrase by the new government, not a national anthem.
The Supreme Court has stayed the High Court's decision to make it the national slogan.
